body_html:
@SpaceCowboy850 There're actually two issues in your case. The first one is the error generated when doing multiprocessing. Actually, there're some errors in the reported code.

# The error code:
print("\n")
sys.stdout.flush()
os._exit(0)
# Why do you want to exit here? If you must do that, wrap it in the if clause.
# If I remove this piece of code, the code runs smoothly when doing multiprocessing.

The second one is that your code crashes when not using multiprocessing. I don't know what's happening there. It is not expected if you compiled the extension in a right way.

body:
@SpaceCowboy850 There're actually two issues in your case. The first one is the error generated when doing multiprocessing. Actually, there're some errors in the reported code.
```Python
# The error code:
print("\n")
sys.stdout.flush()
os._exit(0)
# Why do you want to exit here? If you must do that, wrap it in the if clause.
# If I remove this piece of code, the code runs smoothly when doing multiprocessing.
```
The second one is that your code crashes when not using multiprocessing. I don't know what's happening there. It is not expected if you compiled the extension in a right way.
